subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: McDonald's Golden Arches: Architecture Becomes Logo
description: One-minute skill: McDonald's Golden Arches: Architecture Becomes Logo.

hook.text: McDonald's golden arches weren't designed as a logo. They were the actual shape of the buildings.

buildup.text: Architect Stanley Meston designed golden arches on each side of the 1953 restaurant for visibility.

discovery.text: When viewed from the right angle, the two arches formed an M. Marketing saw the opportunity.

twist.text: A psychologist told McDonald's the arches resemble breasts, evoking comfort. They kept them.

climax.text: The arches are now the second-most recognized symbol globally, after the Christian cross.

punchline.text: The best logos sometimes design themselves.

quiz.question: What were the Golden Arches originally?
options: Actual architectural arches on the buildings
